column4: I think after 2 days I finally have dual boot ubuntu/windows working on my Lenovo computer...sigh
it's installing right now
*quiet splash
I'm installing from a usb drive and I never know when it's time to remove the usb drive. It said it was time to restart so I selected 'restart' and pulled out the drive and now it's frozen
I think I fubar'd it up :(
I wait until it turns off. After you hit restart it does some cleanup/unmounting... sounds like it got a bit fubared still running that stuff.
shutdown, and remove the thumbdrive
grub didn't install for whatever reason...
hmmm. I should be able to go into repair mode and install grub somewhere ya?
I'm in my rescue mode installation now.  I have #1 primary ntfs Boot partiton, #2 primary ntfs, #3 ext4, #4 swap.  I don't have a grub boot location?
grub lives in the MBR of the boot drive... again... typically /dev/sda
yes... grub installs there, and gives you the option to boot into windows or ubuntu... not in a partition, but on the drive assignment... ie /dev/sda     not /dev/sda2 etc
what partition is your ubuntu install on?
sudo -s
mount /dev/sda6 mnt; mount -o bind /dev mnt/dev; mount none -t devpts mnt/dev/pts; mount none -t sysfs mnt/sys
chroot /mnt
grub-install /dev/sda; update-grub
give it a reboot
can you please get me an output of sudo fdisk -l  in pastebin?
That really should have worked.
that will guarantee you are back in the same position.
once you install windows that is...
